meaningMnemonic: The kanji is <kanji>boisterous</kanji>. The verb version is <vocabulary>to make noise</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to be boisterous</vocabulary>. Basically, you're being boisterous when you make a lot of noise, so that's where it comes from.
readingMnemonic: You're always going <vocabulary>to make noise</vocabulary> and be boisterous when you eat something <reading>sour</reading> (さわ). Imagine stuffing lemon slices, sour candy, and umeboshi into your mouth. All at once. See how much noise you make? They're so sour, and they make you so boisterous.
